attributes.action: Allow people to get out of a joint bank account in a abusive relationship
attributes.additional_details:
It makes is very hard for a woman to leave the abusive partner when she can't even get out of an bank account where the powerful partner could bring her in debt/overdraft. 
The right of a victim should be to make the decision to leave when they need to leave.
attributes.background: If you have a joint bank account in the UK- at the moment you need a signature of both parties to take your name out of the joint bank account. Especially in a case of a abusive  relationship it is nearly impossible that the other party will be so nice to let you out of it.

rejection.details:
At the moment, this is the responsibility of banks, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could ask for it to be a legal requirement that banks should allow a person in an abusive relationship to leave a joint bank account.
